data.message:
Merge pull request #786 from nim65s/arch

ROS: document this package as architecture independent

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
ROS: document this package as architecture independent

Fix https://github.com/Gepetto/aig/pull/66

In short, we need `find_package(jrl-cmakemodules CONFIG REQUIRED)` to
work before `project(…)` call, because we want that `project(…)` to use our
`PROJECT_ARGS` from `jrl-cmakemodules`'s `compute_project_args()`.

But as long as `project(…)` with the correct `LANGUAGES` is not run (nor
is `enable_language(…)`), `CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE` is not set,
and therefore, the "Config Mode Search Procedure"
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/find_package.html#config-mode-search-procedure
will not include any `lib/<arch>` paths.

And by default, ROS packages all have `Architecture: any` in their
`debian/control`, which configure the installation of CMake export in
`lib/<arch>`:
https://github.com/ros2-gbp/jrl_cmakemodules-release/blob/debian/ros-humble-jrl-cmakemodules_1.1.0-1_jammy/debian/control#L10

By exporting this `architecture_independent` tag, we should be able to
get `Architecture: all`, and see this package correctly installed in
`lib`

Unfortunately, https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/bloom/pull/705 is
not merged yet.

Fortunately, our lord and savior Nix can easily deal with that not-merged status:
https://github.com/lopsided98/nix-ros-overlay/pull/736

Thanks @MaximilienNaveau for the report and the private follow-ups when
I could not understand or reproduce the issue.

Btw, calling `enable_language(…)` first, then
`find_package(jrl-cmakemodules …)`, and finally `project(…)` is a
working workaround, but CMP0165 decided to strictly forbid this in CMake >= 3.30.

resulting with:

CMake Error at cmake/doxygen.cmake:712 (remove_duplicates):
  remove_duplicates Function invoked with incorrect arguments for function
  named: REMOVE_DUPLICATES
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  cmake/base.cmake:328 (_setup_project_documentation_finalize)
  cmake/base.cmake:228 (setup_project_finalize)
  CMakeLists.txt:9223372036854775807 (SETUP_PROJECT_FINALIZE_HOOK)

data.author: Aaron Miller
data.message:
Fix logging finalization as a subproject (#590)

* Fix logging finalization as a subproject

Previously, including e.g. ProxSuite as a subproject of a CMake project
caused the call to logging_finalize to have an empty
JRL_CMAKEMODULE_LOGGING_FILENAME, which caused files named `##
------------ ##\n` to be created in the project source directory with
contents "the rest of the stuff supposed to be written to
JRL_CMAKEMODULE_LOGGING_FILENAME".  This seems to fix that for my use
case, but I'm not sure if it's generally correct.

Topic: logging-finalize-filename

* [pre-commit.ci] auto fixes from pre-commit.com hooks

for more information, see https://pre-commit.ci

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
Add relpath.cmake

with `REL_INV_INSTALL_PATH(FILE VARIABLE)` to compute the relative
inverse install path of `FILE` and store it into `VARIABLE`

eg:

```
rel_inv_install_path("${CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR}/pkgconfig" _PC_REL_INV_INSTALL_PATH)
set(_PKG_CONFIG_PREFIX "\${pcfiledir}/${_PC_REL_INV_INSTALL_PATH}")
```

and `LIB_REL_RPATH(TARGET_INSTALL_DIR VARIABLE)` to compute the relative
path from this `TARGET_INSTALL_DIR` to `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR`."

eg:
```
set(${PYWRAP}_INSTALL_DIR ${PYTHON_SITELIB}/${PROJECT_NAME})

if(UNIX)
  lib_rel_rpath(${${PYWRAP}_INSTALL_DIR} ${PYWRAP}_INSTALL_RPATH)
  set_target_properties(${PYWRAP} PROPERTIES INSTALL_RPATH "${${PYWRAP}_INSTALL_RPATH}")
endif()

install(TARGETS ${PYWRAP} DESTINATION ${${PYWRAP}_INSTALL_DIR})
```

fix. https://github.com/stack-of-tasks/eigenpy/issues/353
ref. https://github.com/jrl-umi3218/jrl-cmakemodules/pull/587

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
avoid multiple findpython() calls

This add a guard in exported modules to avoid multiple ones calling
successive findpython(), which can fail (for a yet unknown reason).

This is required when package A and B are independant and use and export
findpython(), and package C depends on both.

eg. hpp-gepetto-viewer configuration fails, because its
`add_project_dependency("hpp-corbaserver")` calls findpython(), and then
`add_project_dependency("gepetto-viewer")` calls it again, and fail.

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
set a minimal C++ standard

This commit defines a `SET_MINIMAL_CXX_STANDARD()` macro.

This allows to automatically set CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD if it is not already
manually defined somewhere else (on an equal or greater version), and if
we know that we require a standard version higher than the default one
of the current compiler.

This can avoid to put `set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 11)` in CMakeLists.txt
because C++11 features are required, even if more and more compilers
will default to C++14 and more.

Also, when a package doesn't actually require any particular standard,
but one of its dependency has been compiled with C++11, it's important
to also compile in C++11. For this to work, we just need to call this
macro from the generated *Config.cmake.

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
[find-external] fix CppAD file names

ref https://github.com/stack-of-tasks/pinocchio/pull/1244

As we define lowercase variables (eg. `cppad_FOUND`), we should use
lowercase dependency in `ADD_PROJECT_DEPENDENCY(cppad)`. And for this to
work, the file name must be lowercase `Findcppad.cmake`.

Otherwise, we could define `CppAD_FOUND`, and use
`ADD_PROJECT_DEPENDENCY(CppAD)`, but as we already have some uses of
`cppad_SOMETHING` in the wild, it's too late.

We could provide support for both, if anyone requires it.

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
update GNUInstallDirs.cmake

This is especially useful to stop having to override
CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR, because we get a lib64 default everywhere, even if
nobody has a 32 bits system anymore.

Another option would be to stop shipping this file, which is provided
by CMake >= 2.8.5, but the commit message from 884e3bd4 lacks explicity
about the reasons of the inclusion of this file.

data.author: Sébastien Barthélémy
data.message:
PkgConfig: sanitize pkg_check_modules arguments

...in accordance with cmake's documentation.

freedesktop [1] and perl [2] implementations of pkg-config differ
in the way they parse extra spaces in version constraints
(like eigen3 >= 3.0.5). See the following table for examples showing
 how library names are parsed by the two implementations:

|input              |freedesktop    |perl           |
|                   |0.29.1         |0.23026        |
|-------------------|---------------|---------------|
|"eigen3 >= 3.0.5"  |"eigen3"       |"eigen3"       |
|"eigen3>=3.0.5"    |"eigen3>=3.0.5"|"eigen3>=3.0.5"|
|"eigen3  >=  3.0.5"|"eigen3"       |"eigen3 "      |

cmake's FindPkgConfig.cmake documentation [3] advises
using pkg_check_modules without spaces around the operator.
Hence, one should do:

  pkg_check_modules(EIGEN3 "eigen3>=3.0.5")

The cmake function then adds spaces around the operator
before calling pkg-config (see implementation at [4]).

So if the end-user writes

  pkg_check_modules(EIGEN3 "eigen3 >= 3.0.5")

pkg-config will see "eigen3  >=  3.0.5" and perl's implementation
will look for a lib named "eigen3 " and fail.

With this commit, ADD_*DEPENDENCY macros remove the
extra spaces when calling pkg_check_modules, and thus
ensure compatibility with both pkg-config implementations.

[1] http://pkg-config.freedesktop.org
[2] https://metacpan.org/pod/PkgConfig
[3] https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.15/module/FindPkgConfig.html
[4] https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/v3.15.5/Modules/FindPkgConfig.cmake#L432

will look for a lib named "eigen3 " and fail.

[1] http://pkg-config.freedesktop.org
[2] https://metacpan.org/pod/PkgConfig
[3] https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.15/module/FindPkgConfig.html
[4] https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/blob/v3.15.5/Modules/FindPkgConfig.cmake#L432

data.author: Pierre Gergondet
data.message:
Make it possible to call project() in the root CMakeLists.txt (#242)

* Make it possible to call project() in the root CMakeLists.txt

This deprecates the use of setup_project() in favor of:

```
set(PROJECT_NAME "MyProject")
set(PROJECT_DESCRIPTION "...")
set(PROJECT_URL "...")
include(cmake/base.cmake)
project(${PROJECT_NAME} CXX)
```

which is going to be CMake friendly from 3.15 onwards

To do so, including cmake/base.cmake will have the following effect:
- setup a script to call after project() is called
- compute PROJECT_VERSION and restore its value after project() is
  called (we cannot use the VERSION argument of project() because we
  compute incompatible version numbers)
- setup a hook to call setup_project_finalize() and optionally
  setup_project_package_finalize()

* [base] Add a link to minimal example if variables are not defined

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
ADD_PYTHON_UNIT_TEST: allow multiple paths in argn (#240)

Multiple paths can be set in PYTHONPATH, but they have to be joined by
`os.pathsep`(":" on unix, ";" on windows)
https://docs.python.org/3/using/cmdline.html#envvar-PYTHONPATH

This commit fix the concatenation with any pre-existing environment
variables, and allows to set several folders (relative to the project
build tree) inside this PYTHONPATH.

eg. if you build a module in src/ and a test module in tests/, you can
import them both in a test with:
ADD_PYTHON_UNIT_TEST("test-python" "tests/main.py" "src" "tests")

data.author: Guilhem Saurel
data.message:
add  INSTALL_GENERATED_HEADERS & INSTALL_PKG_CONFIG_FILE options (#233)

* add BINDINGS_ONLY option

For a package which has python bindings, it is convinient to build on
the one hand only the main binary package, and on the other hand several
binary packages with the bindings for different python versions.

For this other packages to be able to co-exist on a system (and ease
transition from Python 2 to Python 3), there must not be any path
conflict, ie. everything must be either in a PYTHON_SITELIB or with a
SOABI depending on the python version.

The automatically generated
- lib/pkgconfig/<project>.pc
- include/<project>/config.hh
- include/<project>/deprecated.hh
- include/<project>/warning.hh
files are preventing this to work.

This PR adds a BINDINGS_ONLY option allows to avoid the installation of
those files.

* split BINDINGS_ONLY into INSTALL_GENERATED_HEADERS & INSTALL_PKG_CONFIG_FILE

* [style] remove end of line spaces

data.author: Olivier Stasse
data.message:
[boost] Add detection of python components such as python-py35
Boost Python on Ubuntu is not following a standard interface.
It is detected by specifyind a component such as python-pyMAJORMINOR.
Under MAC OS, for python3, the component is python3.
This patch detects a component with a python substring.
It is then setting Boost_PYTHON_LIBRARY to Boost_PYTHON-PYMAJORMINOR_LIBRARY.
This should provides the support with minimal impac on others library.

One should simply the proper component when calling FIND_PYTHON,
such as:

SET(Python_ADDITIONAL_VERSIONS 3.5)
FINDPYTHON()

if (${PYTHON_VERSION_MAJOR} EQUAL 3)
  if(UNIX)
    set( BOOST_COMPONENTS python-py35)
  else()
    set( BOOST_COMPONENTS python3)
  endif()
else()
  SET(BOOST_COMPONENTS python)
endif()

In addition this commit provides additional variables related to python
in the logging file config.log

data.author: Pierre Gergondet
data.message:
Add PROJECT_DEBUG_POSTFIX

Setting this variable has the following effects:
- Set CMAKE_DEBUG_POSTFIX to PROJECT_DEBUG_POSTFIX
- Generate a different .pc file named
  ${PROJECT_NAME}${PROJECT_DEBUG_POSTFIX}.pc when building in Debug mode
- Generate two .pc files for multiple build types generators (e.g. Visual
  Studio)

The following macros are added:
- PKG_CONFIG_APPEND_CFLAGS_DEBUG
- PKG_CONFIG_APPEND_CFLAGS_OPTIMIZED

They allow to add specific flags for the debug and optimized version of the
project.

Finally, PKG_CONFIG_APPEND_LIBS was modified to apply the postfix on libraries
built by the project.

Add a PKG_CONFIG_ADD_COMPILE_OPTIONS macro.

data.author: Benjamin Chrétien
data.message:
Add a PKG_CONFIG_ADD_COMPILE_OPTIONS macro.

This macro may help CUDA users forward flags to CUDA_ADD_* macros.
Indeed, SET_TARGET_PROPERTIES does not work on CUDA libraries or
executables, so PKG_CONFIG_USE_COMPILE_DEPENDENCY cannot be used,
and the compiler options need to be given directly to the CUDA_ADD_*
macro (the other option is to modify CUDA_{C/CXX}_FLAGS...).

  SET(${LIB_NAME}_OPTIONS "")
  PKG_CONFIG_ADD_COMPILE_OPTIONS(${LIB_NAME}_OPTIONS my-dependency)
  CUDA_ADD_LIBRARY(${LIB_NAME} ${LIB_SRC}
    SHARED OPTIONS ${${LIB_NAME}_OPTIONS})

data.author: Benjamin Chrétien
data.message:
Update GNUInstallDirs.cmake from CMake's upstream repository.

The following commit should be especially useful:
https://github.com/Kitware/CMake/commit/620939e4e6f5a61cd5c0fac2704de4bfda0eb7ef

From 620939e4e6f5a61cd5c0fac2704de4bfda0eb7ef Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: "Daniele E. Domenichelli" <daniele.domenichelli@iit.it>
Date: Mon, 13 Jan 2014 09:31:34 +0100
Subject: [PATCH] GNUInstallDirs: Fix CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR on Debian

When not installing in /usr (i.e. /usr/local) on Debian/Ubuntu, the
multiarch path is not in ldconfig path, and therefore libraries cannot
be found, unless the user manually modifies the files in
/etc/ld.so.conf.d, in order to include /usr/local/lib/<arch>.

This patch fixes this issue by using "lib/<arch>" only if the user is
installing the software in /usr, and uses "lib" in all the other cases.

python.cmake: add a PYTHON_BUILD macro.

data.author: Benjamin Chrétien
data.message:
python.cmake: add a PYTHON_BUILD macro.

This macros provides a way to build some source file and store them in
the build directory. Then, the install macro can copy those files to the
adequate destination.

Thus, the compilation can be done without calling the "install" target,
which makes it easier to test local modules. We rely on
ADD_CUSTOM_TARGET for the compilation of each file.

Merge pull request #32 from florent-lamiraux/master

Delete cache variables relative to C and CXX compilers in distcheck target

data.author: Florent Lamiraux
data.message:
Delete cache variables relative to C and CXX compilers in distcheck target

  distcheck target copies CmakeCache.txt file and removed two entries.
  With package using catkin, the distcheck target failed since for some reason
  cmake did not source again cmake files checking for C and CXX compilers.

  As a result, CMAKE_LIBRARY_ARCHITECTURE variable is not set and find_package
  macro of roscpp fails to locate libpthread.so because it does not look in
  /usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu (for Ubunutu 12.04 32bits).

  Deleting cache variables relative to the compiler force distcheck target to
  source again the appropriate cmake files.

data.author: Thomas Moulard
data.message:
Tag dependencies includes as system includes.

To avoid importing warnings from external dependencies, the call to
INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES in pkg-config.cmake is now specifying the SYSTEM
keyword to import header directory using the special -isystem flag
when using gcc. These headers will now be considered as "system"
headers and warnings will be discarded for them.

This should allow us to maintain the -Werror flag in as many packages
as possible.

data.author: Francois Keith
data.message:
Correct ros link issue described in issue #20

This issue is due to the order of link flags. As a result, even if
the flags appear in the command line, some symbols are not loaded.
 (appears e.g. on ubuntu 12.04).
Note that the solution used is the same as the one used in
 pkg-config.cmake, method PKG_CONFIG_USE_LLINK_DEPENDENCY

Related link:
https://github.com/jrl-umi3218/jrl-cmakemodules/issues/20

data.author: Francois Keith
data.message:
Correct the link of libraries wrap.so automatically created.

This cancels the default link flag --as-needed, that is added
on compilers since Natty.
Because of this flag, only part of the libraries were linked
with the library wrap.so (libpython was linked, e.g.).
Especially the library normally attached to wrap.so (any plugin of the
stack of tasks) was not linked, since no explicit call to the library
is made.
This cause an error in the import of symbols in python.
By adding the --no-as-needed flag, the link is re-established.

data.author: Thomas Moulard
data.message:
Introduce pkgdatarootdir and fix datarootdir value.

  The rationale is that all pkg-config variables starting with pkg
  contains the project name. The other should point to the /root level/
  of the prefix directory.

  For instance datarootdir MUST point to ${PREFIX}/share.
